awd_titl_txt: Application of DMSP Satellite Data to Antarctic Oceanographyand Meteorology
awd_abstract_narration: This project will develop computer software and techniques to extract           data taken over the polar regions by the Defense Meteorological                 Satellite Program (DMSP) sensors.  These sensors include imagers that           operate in the visible/infra.red range, and profilers that operate in           the microwave range.  These data will extend the antarctic environmental        data base currently produced by the NOAA series of polar orbiters and           captured by ground stations at McMurdo and Palmer.  The DMSP sensors            have a greater resolution than the NOAA series sensors, and have                specific advantages, one of which is that the DMSP Optical Line Scanner         can use moonlight to provide visible spectrum images during the polar           night.                                                                                                                                                          The first year will be devoted to developing software and techniques for        processing the data; the second year will be devoted to defining, in            conjunction with the antarctic meteorological community, applications of        DMSP data to questions concerning atmospheric dynamics, ocean                   circulation, and ice dynamics in and around the antarctic continent.
